DOC.brief_summary: A prospective cohort study compare direct lateral poster-lateral approach concern abductor function . Patients admit femoral neck fracture operate hemiarthroplasty direct lateral poster-lateral approach screen inclusion . Patients alter mental status SPMSQ > 7 , pathological fracture , non-walkers exclude . Those fulfilled inclusion criterion non exclusion criterion follow 1 year postoperatively clinical examination . Sample size estimate 30 patient group . Primary outcome variable trendelenburg test , abductor strength measure dynamometry , trochanteric tenderness measure algometry palptation .
DOC.brief_title: Hip Abductor Strengths , Limping Trochanteric Tenderness After Hip Arthroplasty Due Femoral Neck Fracture
DOC.criteria: Displaced femoral neck fracture Walker Hemarthroplasty Preiffer test > 7/10 Pathological fracture Nonwalker Pfeiffer test < 7/10 indicate mental alteration .
DOC.keyword: Femoral neck fracture , surgical approach , limp , abductor strenght , trochanteric pain
